unvalidated_requirements.name: control-status
unvalidated_requirements.description: The Gin web framework contributes to denial of service protection by enhancing service availability and resilience against high traffic. Its `Recovery` middleware prevents application crashes from panics, ensuring continuous operation, and its high-performance design supports efficient request handling.

statements.description: The `gin.Recovery()` middleware is configured to intercept panics during request processing. Upon detecting a panic, it logs the error (with sensitive `Authorization` headers masked) and prevents the application from terminating, thereby contributing to the service's availability and resilience against unexpected runtime errors that could lead to a denial of service.

As a high-performance web framework built on Go's `net/http` library, Gin is designed for efficient request routing and handling. This inherent performance characteristic aids in processing a high volume of requests without degradation, contributing to an increased capacity to resist certain forms of denial of service attacks based on traffic volume.
